p: TlAlH 4 decomposed at −80 °C (1.9 wt.% hydrogen content). Wiberg et al. tried the metathesis reaction between TiCl 3 and LiAlH 4 in ether at −115 °C [ 258]. However, no Tl +3-alanate could be isolated from the reaction of TlCl 3 and LiAlH 4, with the product spontaneously decomposing at −110 °C [ 258, 259]. A marginal stabilization was achieved when a Cl − substituted an [AlH 4] − ion: TlCl(AlH 4) 2 was produced by the reaction between TlCl 3 and AlH 3 in ether at −115 °C in the presence of AlH 3·AlCl 3 [ 259]. TlCl(AlH 4) 2 decomposed at −95 °C [ 259].
